when_to_use: Create a strong visual introduction to a page's content
Communicate the main purpose or theme of a page
Include primary and secondary call-to-action buttons for key user journeys
Establish visual hierarchy at the top of a page
when_not_to_use: The page requires a minimalist introduction without visual emphasis
Space is at a premium and a full-width banner would push important content below the fold
The page serves a purely functional purpose where a visual banner might distract users from completing tasks
Multiple banners would be needed on a single page, creating visual competition and confusion
best_practices: Ensure the heading clearly communicates the page's purpose, with supporting text that provides necessary context while remaining concise
Use background images that enhance rather than compete with content. Images should maintain sufficient contrast with text elements
Ensure the banner adapts appropriately across devices, with readable text and properly scaled imagery on all screen sizes
Limit buttons to a maximum of two, with clear hierarchy between primary and secondary actions. Button text should be action-oriented
When using breadcrumbs within the banner, ensure they provide clear navigational context while maintaining visual distinction from other banner elements
Maintain sufficient colour contrast between text and background. If using background images, ensure they don't interfere with text legibility
Optimise images for quick loading, especially on mobile devices, to avoid negatively impacting performance metrics

criteria_met.notes: The background image is considered decoration and can be ignored by screen readers
Text is still visible and readable when resized to at least 200%
Elements are accessible using keyboard only
Focus is visible when navigating using a keyboard
Text remains visible and readable with adjusted spacing parameters

known_issues: Mobile responsiveness: On some smaller mobile devices, the banner's text and buttons may appear crowded, affecting usability and visual appeal
Image loading: Large background images can impact page load performance, particularly on slower connections
Breadcrumb visibility: In some implementations, breadcrumbs may not have sufficient contrast against certain background images
variations: With Featured Image: Banner includes a featured image positioned on the right side (desktop)
Without Featured Image: Banner with full-width content layout
With Breadcrumbs: Banner includes breadcrumb navigation
With Background Image: Banner with background image and blend mode options
Decorative Variant: Banner with decorative clip-path effects and enhanced visual styling

findings: Users appreciate the visual prominence of the component for establishing page context
Call-to-action buttons within banners receive good engagement when clearly labelled
Breadcrumb integration helps users understand their location within the site architecture
